content:
Diagnosis:	T2N0M0 squamous cell carcinoma of right oral tongue

Management:	15 Jan 2024 Right partial glossectomy
		12 Feb - 20 Mar 2024 Adjuvant radiotherapy 60Gy in 30 fractions

Histology:	Moderately differentiated squamous cell carcinoma, 2.8cm diameter, depth of invasion 8mm, clear margins (>5mm), no lymphovascular invasion

Current Situation:	Routine follow-up post treatment

I reviewed [redacted name] today in the head and neck follow-up clinic. He has made an excellent recovery following completion of adjuvant radiotherapy 6 weeks ago. His speech is now clear and easily understood. Swallowing has improved significantly with only occasional difficulty with dry foods. He maintains good oral intake and stable weight. He has returned to work part-time as an accountant.

On examination today, the surgical site shows good healing with no concerning features. No palpable cervical lymphadenopathy. The rest of the oral cavity appears healthy.

I have arranged routine follow-up in 3 months with surveillance imaging at 6 months as per protocol. He understands to contact us sooner if any new concerns develop.
